author: Dennis S
text:
The Southern Bench of the National Green Tribunal has granted an interim injunction against a construction company from carrying out construction activity on Seshadri Road, Alwarpet, during night hours.

The Bench comprising Justice P. Jyothimani and expert member P.S. Rao granted the injunction on Friday last, while hearing an application filed by petitioners Sashi Kumar B. Menon and Zaheer Ahmed Sayeed, residents of ‘Palmwoods’ on Seshadri Road.

They had objected to construction by M/s Baashyam Constructions Pvt. Ltd. at Sadhar Gardens during the night hours after 6 pm.

The Bench further directed the issuing of notice to authorities concerned, including the Chennai Police Commissioner, the Chennai Metropolitan Development Authority (CMDA), the Corporation of Chennai and the Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) and private notice to M/s Baashyam Constructions Pvt. Ltd. to appear before it on February 9.

The petitioners sought a direction to the authorities concerned to take appropriate action on the representation dated January 8 against the company from carrying on construction or laying the foundation using driven-pile method or any other method that causes noise pollution.

They also sought a direction against construction in the night hours and on all seven days of week and suggested the activity stop at least one day in a week. Counsel appearing for the petitioners said, “As per the interim injunction, there should not be any construction activity during nights, and as for the driven-pile method, the tribunal would pass order after hearing the respondents on February 9.”

Petition opposes building activity on Seshadri Road after 6 pm
title: National Green Tribunal bars construction at night
